title: Switching to full screen leaves black borders
author: SimFre
body_snippet:
Switching RDP into full screen doesn't change the connected resolution to match client screen, instead it stays the same as windowed, but with black borders.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9532326/55952980-3277c480-5c5b-11e9-88ec-6927c6bca537.png)


## Expected Behavior
True full screen

## Current Behavior
RDP uses the windowed size, but in full screen leaving black borders.

## Possible Solution
Re-adjust window size like when resizing the window.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
What settings do you have for the `Resolution` and `Automatic Resize` connection properties?

`Resolution: Fit to Panel` and `Automatic Resize: Yes` should behave as you expect (connection will resize when switching to full screen).

comments.author: SimFre
comments.snippet:
It is Resolution: Fit to panel and Automatic Resize: Yes. But I think the issue here might be a few different modes of full screen.

1. Setting the app to full screen (View / Full Screen [F11]) is practically like the window setting -- resizes and hides windows task bar. Sort-of-kind-of-fullscreen-ish. Let's call this "fake full screen".
2. Right click and Connect in full screen works correctly.

comments.author: dsorm
comments.snippet: I can confirm this weird behavior too. "Connect in full screen" works correctly but if I connect and then try to full screen it, I end up with black borders too. Ctrl+Alt+Pause does the same.
